member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueue
member.summary: Manages a prioritized queue on which tasks execute in a serial fashion on a thread.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueue.HasThreadAccess
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the DispatcherQueue has access to the current thread.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueue.ShutdownCompleted
member.summary: Fires after the **DispatcherQueue** event loop stops which is the last step in the **DispatcherQueue** shutdown process.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueue.ShutdownStarting
member.summary: Fires before the dispatcher queue initiates an exit from its event loop.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueue.CreateTimer
member.summary: Creates a **DispatcherQueueTimer** on the **DispatcherQueue** to execute a task periodically after a time interval has elapsed.
member.returns: An **DispatcherQueueTimer** that can queue tasks on a timed basis to the current **DispatcherQueue**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueue.GetForCurrentThread
member.summary: Gets the **DispatcherQueue** associated with the current thread.
member.returns: A **DispatcherQueue** instance that will execute tasks serially on the current thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueue.TryEnqueue(Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueHandler)
member.summary: Adds a task to the **DispatcherQueue** which will be executed on the thread associated with the **DispatcherQueue**.
member.param: The task to execute.
member.returns: **True** indicates that the task was added to the queue; **false**, otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueue.TryEnqueue(Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueuePriority,Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueHandler)
member.summary: Adds a task to the **DispatcherQueue** which will be executed on the thread associated with the **DispatcherQueue**.
member.param: The priority of the task such as Low, Normal, or High.
A delegate to the task to execute.
member.returns: **True** indicates that the task was added to the queue; **false**, otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueController
member.summary: Manages the lifetime of a DispatcherQueue. Provides methods to create and shutdown the **DispatcherQueue**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueController.DispatcherQueue
member.summary: Gets the **DispatcherQueue** associated with this **DispatcherQueueController**.
member.returns: The **DispatcherQueue** instance that you use to queue tasks that run on a thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueController.CreateOnDedicatedThread
member.summary: Creates a DispatcherQueue that you can use to run tasks on a dedicated thread.
member.returns: The created **DispatcherQueueController**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueController.ShutdownQueueAsync
member.summary: Stops the **DispatcherQueue** associated with this **DispatcherQueueController**. Shuts down the thread if the **DispatcherQueueController** was created by **CreateOnDedicatedThread**.
member.returns: An asynchronous operation which will complete after the queue has dispatched all of its remaining work.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueHandler
member.summary: A callback that will be executed on the **DispatcherQueue** thread.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueuePriority
member.summary: Defines the priority levels that can be given to work assigned to a DispatcherQueue.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueuePriority.High
member.summary: Work scheduled at **High** priority will be dispatched first, along with other **High** priority System tasks, before processing **Normal** or **Low** priority work.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueuePriority.Low
member.summary: **Low** priority work will be scheduled when there isn't any other work to process. Work at **Low** priority can be preempted by new incoming **High** and **Normal** priority tasks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueuePriority.Normal
member.summary: Work will be dispatched once all **High** priority tasks are dispatched. If a new **High** priority work is scheduled, all new **High** priority tasks are processed before resuming **Normal** tasks. This is the default priority.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueShutdownStartingEventArgs
member.summary: Provides the arguments for the ShutdownStarting event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueShutdownStartingEventArgs.GetDeferral
member.summary: Gets a deferral object so that you can use to continue to post work to the **DisbpatcherQueue** until you mark the deferral complete.
member.returns: The deferral object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueTimer
member.summary: Executes a task in a **DispatcherQueue** periodically after a time interval has elapsed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueTimer.Interval
member.summary: Gets and sets the interval for the timer.
member.returns: The amount of time before the timer ticks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueTimer.IsRepeating
member.summary: Indicates whether the timer is repeating.
member.returns: **True** indicates that the timer fires every **DispatcherQueueTimer.Interval**; **false** means that it fires once, after **DispatcherQueueTimer.Interval** elapses.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueTimer.IsRunning
member.summary: Indicates whether the timer is currently running.
member.returns: **True** indicates that the timer is running; otherwise **false**

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueTimer.Tick
member.summary: Event that fires when the timer **Interval** elapses.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueTimer.Start
member.summary: Starts the timer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Dispatching.DispatcherQueueTimer.Stop
member.summary: Stops the timer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.ColorHelper
member.summary: Provides static helper methods for processing Color values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.ColorHelper.FromArgb(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Generates a Color structure, based on discrete **Byte** values for **ARGB** components.
member.param: The **A** (transparency) component of the desired color. Range is 0-255.
The **R** component of the desired color. Range is 0-255.
The **G** component of the desired color. Range is 0-255.
The **B** component of the desired color. Range is 0-255.
member.returns: The generated Color value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationController
member.summary: Provides playback controls for a KeyFrameAnimation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationController.MaxPlaybackRate
member.summary: Gets the maximum allowed playback rate.
member.returns: The maximum allowed playback rate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationController.MinPlaybackRate
member.summary: Gets the minimum allowed playback rate.
member.returns: The minimum allowed playback rate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationController.PlaybackRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the rate at which the animation plays.
member.returns: The rate at which the animation plays. The default is 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationController.Progress
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the current playback position of the animation.
member.returns: The current playback position of the animation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationController.ProgressBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates how progress is determined.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration that indicates how progress is determined. The default is **Default**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationController.Pause
member.summary: Pauses playback of the animation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationController.Resume
member.summary: Starts playback of an animation that was previously paused.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationControllerProgressBehavior
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how the AnimationController.Progress value is determined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationControllerProgressBehavior.Default
member.summary: The progress value does not include delay time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationControllerProgressBehavior.IncludesDelayTime
member.summary: The progress value includes delay time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationDelayBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the animation delay behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationDelayBehavior.SetInitialValueAfterDelay
member.summary: Does not compute anything in animation nor holds the value of composition object property. If a DelayTime is specified, it delays starting the animation according to delay time and after delay has expired it applies animation to the object property.ï¿½

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationDelayBehavior.SetInitialValueBeforeDelay
member.summary: Applies the initial value of the animation (i.e. the value at Keyframe 0) to the object before the delay time is elapsed (when there is a DelayTime specified), it then delays starting the animation according to the DelayTime.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationDirection
member.summary: Specifies the play direction of an animation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationDirection.Alternate
member.summary: Alternate between normal and reverse playback.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationDirection.AlternateReverse
member.summary: Alternate between reverse and normal playback.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationDirection.Normal
member.summary: Play the animation from start to end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationDirection.Reverse
member.summary: Play the animation in reverse from end to start.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationIterationBehavior
member.summary: Specifies if the animation should loop.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationIterationBehavior.Count
member.summary: The animation should loop the specified number of times.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationIterationBehavior.Forever
member.summary: The animation should loop forever.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationPropertyAccessMode
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how an animated property can be accessed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationPropertyAccessMode.None
member.summary: The property cannot be accessed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationPropertyAccessMode.ReadOnly
member.summary: The property can only be read.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationPropertyAccessMode.ReadWrite
member.summary: The property can be read or written to.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.AnimationPropertyAccessMode.WriteOnly
member.summary: The property can only be written to.

member.summary: Interpolate a color from the four bitmap pixels that are the nearest to the current rendering pixel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionBitmapInterpolationMode.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: Use the exact color of the nearest bitmap pixel to the current rendering pixel.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionCapabilities
member.summary: Provides the ability to check system hardware capabilities so that Visual Layer Effects may be scaled accordingly. This allows you to ensure that your application's use of rendering-intensive operations is tailored to match the device's capabilities, providing optimum performance and pleasant visual results.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionCapabilities.Changed
member.summary: Event triggered when the supported composition capabilities changes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionCapabilities.AreEffectsFast
member.summary: Indicates whether fast effects are supported.
member.returns: Returns a boolean indicating whether fast effects are supported.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionCapabilities.AreEffectsSupported
member.summary: Indicates whether effects are supported.
member.returns: Returns a boolean indicating whether effects are supported.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionCapabilities.GetForCurrentView
member.summary: Gets the supported composition capabilities for the current view.
member.returns: Returns the supported composition capabilities for the current view.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionClip
member.summary: Base class for clipping objects such as InsetClip.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionClip.AnchorPoint
member.summary: The point on the clip to be positioned at the clip's offset. Value is normalized with respect to the size of the clip.
member.returns: The point on the clip to be positioned at the clip's offset. Value is normalized with respect to the size of the clip. An AnchorPoint value of (0, 0) refers to the top-left corner of the untransformed clip and a value of (1, 1) refers to the bottom-right corner. Negative values and values greater than one are accepted but will result in an AnchorPoint that is outside the boundaries of the original, untransformed clip.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionClip.CenterPoint
member.summary: The point about which rotation or scaling occurs.
member.returns: The point about which rotation or scaling occurs. Value is in pixels within the local coordinate space of the visual on which the clip is applied.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionClip.Offset
member.summary: The offset of the clip relative to the visual on which the clip is applied.
member.returns: The offset of the clip relative to the visual on which the clip is applied. By default, the Offset value on a clip is (0, 0).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionClip.RotationAngle
member.summary: The angle of rotation applied to the clip, in radians.
member.returns: The angle of rotation applied to the clip, in radians. For a CompositionClip, the axis of rotation is always about the z-axis, with positive RotationAngle values resulting in a clockwise rotation and negative values resulting in a counter-clockwise rotation. For specifying RotationAngle in degrees, use CompositionClip.RotationAngleInDegrees.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionClip.RotationAngleInDegrees
member.summary: The angle of rotation applied to the clip, in degrees.
member.returns: The angle of rotation applied to the clip, in degrees. For a CompositionClip, the axis of rotation is always about the z-axis, with positive RotationAngleInDegrees values resulting in a clockwise rotation and negative values resulting in a counter-clockwise rotation. For specifying RotationAngle in radians, use CompositionClip.RotationAngle.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionClip.Scale
member.summary: The scale to apply to the clip.
member.returns: The scale to apply to the clip. The scale value is a multiplier of the clip's size. By default, the Scale value on a clip is (1, 1).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionClip.TransformMatrix
member.summary: The 3x2 transformation matrix to apply to the clip.
member.returns: The transformation matrix to apply to the clip. By default, the TransformMatrix is set to:

The source of the opacity mask can be any CompositionBrush of type CompositionColorBrush, CompositionLinearGradientBrush, CompositionSurfaceBrush, CompositionEffectBrush or a CompositionNineGridBrush. The opacity mask must be specified as a CompositionSurfaceBrush.

member.returns: An enumeration value that specifies the type of join used at the vertices of a shape. The default is **Miter**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSpriteShape.StrokeMiterLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a limit on the ratio of the miter length to half the StrokeThickness of a shape element.
member.returns: The limit on the ratio of the miter length to the StrokeThickness of a shape element. This value is always a positive number that is greater than or equal to 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSpriteShape.StrokeStartCap
member.summary: Gets or sets a CompositionStrokeCap enumeration value that specifies how the start of a line is drawn.
member.returns: An enumeration value that specifies how the start of a line is drawn. The default is **Flat**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSpriteShape.StrokeThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the shape outline.
member.returns: The width of the shape outline, in pixels. The default value is 0.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStretch
member.summary: Specifies how content is scaled when mapped from its source to a destination space.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStretch.Fill
member.summary: Scale content such that its size is equal to the size of the destination. The aspect ratio of the content is not preserved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStretch.None
member.summary: No Scaling. If the size of the content is greater than size of destination, the content is clipped to the bounds of the destination space.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStretch.Uniform
member.summary: Scale content such that its aspect ratio is preserved and it fits entirely within the bounds of the destination space. If the contentâs aspect ratio does not match that of the destination, the content will not cover some of the area bound by the destination space. This is the default value for CompositionSurfaceBrush.Stretch.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStretch.UniformToFill
member.summary: Scale content such that its aspect ratio is preserved and it fills the entirety of the destinationâs bounds. If the contentâs aspect ratio does not match that of the destination, the content will be clipped to the bounds of the destination.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStrokeCap
member.summary: Defines constants that specify the shape at the end of a line or segment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStrokeCap.Flat
member.summary: A cap that does not extend past the last point of the line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStrokeCap.Round
member.summary: A semicircle that has a diameter equal to the line thickness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStrokeCap.Square
member.summary: Half of a square that has a length equal to the line thickness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStrokeCap.Triangle
member.summary: An isosceles right triangle whose hypotenuse is equal in length to the thickness of the line.

member.summary: Defines constants that specify the shape used to join two lines or segments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStrokeLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: Line joins use beveled vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStrokeLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: Line joins use regular angular vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStrokeLineJoin.MiterOrBevel
member.summary: Line joins use regular angular vertices unless the join would extend beyond the miter limit; otherwise, line joins use beveled vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionStrokeLineJoin.Round
member.summary: Line joins use rounded vertices.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush
member.summary: Paints a SpriteVisual with pixels from an ICompositionSurface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.AnchorPoint
member.summary: The point on the brush to be positioned at the brush's offset. Value is normalized with respect to the size of the SpriteVisual.
member.returns: The point on the brush to be positioned at the brush's offset. Value is normalized with respect to the size of the SpriteVisual.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.BitmapInterpolationMode
member.summary: Specifies the algorithm used for interpolating pixels from ICompositionSurface when they do not form a one-to-one mapping to pixels on SpriteVisual (as can happen under stretch, scale, rotation, and other transformations).
member.returns: Specifies the algorithm used for interpolating pixels from ICompositionSurface when they do not form a one-to-one mapping to pixels on SpriteVisual (as can happen under stretch, scale, rotation, and other transformations).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.CenterPoint
member.summary: The point about which the brush is rotated and scaled.
member.returns: The point about which the brush is rotated and scaled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.HorizontalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Controls the positioning of the vertical axis of content with respect to the vertical axis of the SpriteVisual. The value is clamped from 0.0f to 1.0f with 0.0f representing the left vertical edge and 1.0f representing the right vertical edge of the SpriteVisual. By default this is set to 0.0f.
member.returns: The positioning of the vertical axis of content with respect to the vertical axis of the SpriteVisual. The value is clamped from 0.0f to 1.0f with 0.0f representing the left vertical edge and 1.0f representing the right vertical edge of the SpriteVisual. The default value is 0.5f.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.Offset
member.summary: The offset of the brush relative to its SpriteVisual.
member.returns: The offset of the brush relative to its SpriteVisual.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.RotationAngle
member.summary: The rotation angle, in radians, of the brush.
member.returns: The rotation angle, in radians, of the brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.RotationAngleInDegrees
member.summary: The rotation angle, in degrees, of the brush.
member.returns: The rotation angle, in degrees, of the brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.Scale
member.summary: The scale to apply to the brush.
member.returns: The scale to apply to the brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.Stretch
member.summary: Controls the scaling that is applied to the contents the ICompositionSurface with respect to the size of theâ¯SpriteVisual that is being painted.
member.returns: Controls how the brush's content is scaled with respect to the size of the SpriteVisual it is painted onto.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.Surface
member.summary: The ICompositionSurface associated with the CompositionSurfaceBrush.
member.returns: The composition surface associated with the CompositionSurfaceBrush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.TransformMatrix
member.summary: The transformation matrix to apply to the brush.
member.returns: The transformation matrix to apply to the brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionSurfaceBrush.VerticalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Controls the positioning of the horizontal axis of content with respect to the horizontal axis of the SpriteVisual. The value is clamped from 0.0f to 1.0f with 0.0f representing the top horizontal edge and 1.0f representing the bottom horizontal edge of the SpriteVisual. The default value is 0.5f.
member.returns: The positioning of the horizontal axis of content with respect to the horizontal axis of the SpriteVisual.

member.summary: A Composition Animation that uses a mathematical equation to calculate the value for an animating property every frame.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Composition.ExpressionAnimation.Expression
member.summary: The mathematical equation specifying how the animated value is calculated each frame. The Expression is the core of an ExpressionAnimation and represents the equation the system will use to calculate the value of the animation property each frame. The equation is set on this property in the form of a string.
member.returns: The mathematical equation specifying how the animated value is calculated each frame.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Composition.Interactions.InteractionTrackerClampingOption
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how values are clamped when the InteractionTracker position is updated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.Interactions.InteractionTrackerClampingOption.Auto
member.summary: If the input value is greater (or less) than the max (or min) value, it is immediately clamped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Composition.Interactions.InteractionTrackerClampingOption.Disabled
member.summary: If the input value is greater (or less) than the max (or min) value, it is not immediately clamped. Instead, the max/min is enforced to the newly input value of Position (and potentially clamped) the next time InteractionTracker enters the Inertia state.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum
member.summary: Defines constants that identify text attributes of a Microsoft UI Automation text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.AnimationStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **AnimationStyle** text attribute, which specifies the type of animation applied to the text. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationAnimationStyle enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.AnnotationObjectsAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **AnnotationObjects** text attribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.AnnotationTypesAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **AnnotationTypes** text attribute, which maintains a list of annotation type identifiers for a range of text. This attribute is specified as a value of the AnnotationType enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.BackgroundColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **BackgroundColor** text attribute, which specifies the background color of the text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.BulletStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **BulletStyle** text attribute, which specifies the style of bullets used in the text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationBulletStyle enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CapStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **CapStyle** text attribute, which specifies the capitalization style for the text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CaretBidiModeAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **CaretBidiMode** text attribute, which indicates the direction of text flow in the text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationCaretBidiMode enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CaretPositionAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **CaretPosition** text attribute, which indicates whether the caret is at the beginning or the end of a line of text in the text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationCaretPosition enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CultureAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **Culture** text attribute, which specifies the locale of the text by locale identifier (LCID).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.FontNameAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **FontName** text attribute, which specifies the name of the font. Examples: "Arial Black"; "Arial Narrow". The font name string is not localized.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.FontSizeAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **FontSize** text attribute, which specifies the point size of the font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.FontWeightAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **FontWeight** text attribute, which specifies the relative stroke, thickness, or boldness of the font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.ForegroundColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **ForegroundColor** text attribute, which specifies the foreground color of the text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.HorizontalTextAlignmentAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **HorizontalTextAlignment** text attribute, which specifies how the text is aligned horizontally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IndentationFirstLineAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **IndentationFirstLine** text attribute, which specifies how far, in points, to indent the first line of a paragraph.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IndentationLeadingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **IndentationLeading** text attribute, which specifies the leading indentation, in points.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IndentationTrailingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **IndentationTrailing** text attribute, which specifies the trailing indentation, in points.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsActiveAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **IsActive** text attribute, which indicates whether the control that contains the text range has the keyboard focus (**true**) or not (**false**).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsHiddenAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **IsHidden** text attribute, which indicates whether the text is hidden (**true**) or visible (**false**).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsItalicAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **IsItalic** text attribute, which indicates whether the text is italic (**true**) or not (**false**).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsReadOnlyAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **IsReadOnly** text attribute, which indicates whether the text is read-only (**true**) or can be modified (**false**).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsSubscriptAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **IsSubscript** text attribute, which indicates whether the text is subscript (**true**) or not (**false**).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsSuperscriptAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **IsSuperscript** text attribute, which indicates whether the text is subscript (**true**) or not (**false**).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.LinkAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **Link** text attribute, which contains the ITextRangeProvider interface of the text range that is the target of an internal link in a document.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginBottomAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **MarginBottom** text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the bottom margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginLeadingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **MarginLeading** text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the leading margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginTopAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **MarginTop** text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the top margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginTrailingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **MarginTrailing** text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the trailing margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.OutlineStylesAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **OutlineStyles** text attribute, which specifies the outline style of the text. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationOutlineStyles enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.OverlineColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **OverlineColor** text attribute, which specifies the color of the overline text decoration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.OverlineStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **OverlineStyle** text attribute, which specifies the style of the overline text decoration. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.SelectionActiveEndAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **SelectionActiveEnd** text attribute, which indicates the location of the caret relative to a text range that represents the currently selected text. This attribute is specified as a value from the AutomationActiveEnd enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StrikethroughColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **StrikethroughColor** text attribute, which specifies the color of the strikethrough text decoration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StrikethroughStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **StrikethroughStyle** text attribute, which specifies the style of the strikethrough text decoration. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StyleIdAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **StyleId** text attribute, which indicates the text styles in use for a text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationStyleId enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StyleNameAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **StyleName** text attribute, which identifies the localized name of the text style in use for a text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.TabsAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **Tabs** text attribute, which is an array specifying the tab stops for the text range. Each array element specifies a distance, in points, from the leading margin.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.TextFlowDirectionsAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **TextFlowDirections** text attribute, which specifies the direction of text flow. This attribute is specified as a combination of values of the AutomationFlowDirections enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.UnderlineColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **UnderlineColor** text attribute, which specifies the color of the underline text decoration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.UnderlineStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the **UnderlineStyle** text attribute, which specifies the style of the underline text decoration. This attribute is specified as a value of the AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle enumeration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions
member.summary: Represents the options that can be applied when an element is brought into view.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BringIntoViewOptions class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.AnimationDesired
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to use animation when the element is brought into view.
member.returns: **true** to use animation; otherwise, **false**. The default is **true**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.HorizontalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Controls the positioning of the vertical axis of the TargetRect with respect to the vertical axis of the viewport. The value is clamped from 0.0f to 1.0f with 0.0f representing the left vertical edge and 1.0f representing the right vertical edge. By default this is set to 0.0f.
member.returns: A value that specifies the positioning of the vertical axis of the TargetRect with respect to the vertical axis of the viewport. The default is 0.0f.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.HorizontalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested HorizontalAlignmentRatio.
member.returns: The horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested HorizontalAlignmentRatio.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.TargetRect
member.summary: Gets or sets the area of an element to bring into view.
member.returns: A rectangle that defines the area of an element to bring into view.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.VerticalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Controls the positioning of the horizontal axis of the TargetRect with respect to the horizontal axis of the viewport. The value is clamped from 0.0f to 1.0f with 0.0f representing the top horizontal edge and 1.0f representing the bottom horizontal edge. By default this is set to 0.0f.
member.returns: A value that specifies the positioning of the horizontal axis of the TargetRect with respect to the horizontal axis of the viewport. The default is 0.0f.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.VerticalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested VerticalAlignmentRatio.
member.returns: The vertical distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested VerticalAlignmentRatio.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the UIElement.BringIntoViewRequested event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.AnimationDesired
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the scrolling should be animated.
member.returns: **true** to animate the scrolling; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the routed event as handled. A **true** value prevents most handlers along the event route from handling the same event again.
member.returns: **true** to mark the routed event handled. **false** to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further and be acted on by other handlers. The default is **false**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.HorizontalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Gets the horizontal distance that should be added to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested HorizontalAlignmentRatio.
member.returns: The horizontal distance that should be added to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested HorizontalAlignmentRatio.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.HorizontalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested HorizontalAlignmentRatio.
member.returns: The horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested HorizontalAlignmentRatio.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.TargetElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the element that should be made visible in response to the event.
member.returns: The element that should be made visible in response to the event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.TargetRect
member.summary: Gets or sets the Rect in the TargetElementâs coordinate space to bring into view.
member.returns: The Rect in the TargetElementâs coordinate space to bring into view.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.VerticalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Gets the vertical distance that should be added to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested VerticalAlignmentRatio.
member.returns: The vertical distance that should be added to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested VerticalAlignmentRatio.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DataContextChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the DataContextChanged event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DataContextChangedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that influences whether another DataContextChanged event should be fired from child elements that inherit the DataContext value and detect that the value has changed.
member.returns: **true** to prevent further DataContextChanged events from being fired for each child FrameworkElement that inherits the DataContext value. You would do this to indicate to other handlers that the necessary logic for responding to the data context change has already been performed. **false** to permit the event to be fired by each immediate child FrameworkElement in the element tree that detects a change to the inherited DataContext value. The default is **false**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DataContextChangedEventArgs.NewValue
member.summary: Gets the new DataContext value for the element where the DataContextChanged event fired.
member.returns: An object representing the new DataContext value for the element where the DataContextChanged event fired.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings
member.summary: Declares how certain aspects of the app behave when it is run in a debug environment

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.EnableFrameRateCounter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to display frame-rate and per-frame CPU usage info. These display as an overlay of counters in the window chrome while the app runs.
member.returns: **true** to display the overlay debug counters; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.EnableRedrawRegions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to highlight areas of the app UI surface that are being redrawn each frame.
member.returns: **true** to highlight redraw regions. **false** to not highlight redraw regions. The default is **false**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.FailFastOnErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether XAML errors cause an immediate FailFast rather than returning an error.
member.returns: **true** if XAML errors cause an immediate FailFast rather than returning an error; otherwise, **false**. The default is **false**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.IsBindingTracingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to engage the binding tracing feature of Microsoft Visual Studio when the app runs.
member.returns: **true** to engage the binding tracing feature of Microsoft Visual Studio; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.IsOverdrawHeatMapEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that enables a debug setting that visualizes overdraw operations. This visualization is useful during application development for detecting layout, animation, and other operations that are graphics processing intensive.
member.returns: **true** to enable the visualization, otherwise, **false**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.IsTextPerformanceVisualizationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to engage the text performance visualization feature of Microsoft Visual Studio when the app runs.
member.returns: **true** to engage the text performance visualization feature of Microsoft Visual Studio; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject
member.summary: Represents an object that participates in the dependency property system.Â DependencyObject is the immediate base class of many important UI-related classes, such as UIElement, Geometry, FrameworkTemplate, Style, and ResourceDictionary. For more info on how DependencyObject supports dependency properties, see Dependency properties overview.

member.returns: The CoreDispatcher that DependencyObject object is associated with, which represents the UI thread.

member.summary: Registers a notification function for listening to changes to a specific DependencyProperty on this DependencyObject instance.

A callback based on the DependencyPropertyChangedCallback delegate, which the system invokes when the value of the specified property changes.
member.returns: A token that represents the callback, used to identify the callback in calls to UnregisterPropertyChangedCallback.

The new local value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject.UnregisterPropertyChangedCallback(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty,System.Int64)
member.summary: Cancels a change notification that was previously registered by calling RegisterPropertyChangedCallback.
member.param: The dependency property identifier of the property to unregister for property-changed notification.
A token that represents the callback (returned by RegisterPropertyChangedCallback ).

member.summary: Registers a dependency property with the specified property name, property type, owner type, and property metadata for the property. Use this method when defining or initializing a DependencyObject derived class that will own the registered dependency property.

The type of the property, as a type reference (System.Type for Microsoft .NET, a TypeName helper struct for VisualÂ C++ component extensions (C++/CX)).
The owner type that is registering the dependency property, as a type reference (System.Type for Microsoft .NET, a TypeName helper struct for VisualÂ C++ component extensions (C++/CX)).
A property metadata instance. This can contain a PropertyChangedCallback implementation reference.
member.returns: A dependency property identifier that typically is stored in a publicÂ staticÂ read-only field in your DependencyObject derived class. The identifier is then used both by your own code and any third-party user code to reference the dependency property later, for operations such as setting its value programmatically or attaching a Binding in code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty.RegisterAttached(System.String,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.PropertyMetadata)

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FocusVisualKind
member.summary: Specifies the visual feedback used to indicate the UI element with focus when navigating with a keyboard or gamepad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FocusVisualKind.DottedLine
member.summary: A dotted line rectangle. Also known as "marching ants".

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FocusVisualKind.HighVisibility
member.summary: A solid line rectangle composed of an inner and outer rectangle of contrasting colors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FocusVisualKind.Reveal
member.summary: A solid line rectangle, surrounded by a glowing light effect to simulate depth.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals
member.summary: Describes the capital letter style value for the Typography.Capitals attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.AllPetiteCaps
member.summary: Both capital and lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height. Petite capitals are smaller than small capitals.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.AllSmallCaps
member.summary: Both capital and lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.Normal
member.summary: Capital letters render normally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.PetiteCaps
member.summary: Lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height. Petite capitals are smaller than small capitals.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.SmallCaps
member.summary: Lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.Titling
member.summary: Glyph forms are substituted with a typographic form specifically designed for titles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.Unicase
member.summary: Capital letters display in unicase. Unicase fonts render both uppercase and lowercase letters in a mixture of uppercase and lowercase glyphs determined by the type designer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for selecting font-specific versions of glyphs for a specified East Asian writing system or language.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.HojoKanji
member.summary: Replaces default glyphs with the corresponding forms from the Hojo Kanji specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis04
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS04 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis78
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS78 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis83
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS83 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis90
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS90 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.NlcKanji
member.summary: Replaces default glyphs with the corresponding forms from the NLC Kanji specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Normal
member.summary: No font-specific glyph versions are applied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Simplified
member.summary: Replaces traditional Chinese or Japanese forms with their corresponding simplified forms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Traditional
member.summary: Replaces simplified Chinese or Japanese forms with their corresponding traditional forms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.TraditionalNames
member.summary: Replaces simplified Kanji forms with their corresponding traditional forms. This glyph set is explicitly limited to the traditional forms considered proper for use in personal names.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for selecting glyphs of different width styles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Full
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with full width (usually em) glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Half
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with half width (half em) glyphs

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Normal
member.summary: Default width style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Proportional
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with proportionally spaced glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Quarter
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with one-quarter width (one-quarter em) glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Third
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with one-third width (one-third em) glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontFraction.Slashed
member.summary: Stacked fraction style is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontFraction.Stacked
member.summary: Slashed fraction style is used.

member.summary: Default numeral alignment is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralAlignment.Proportional
member.summary: Proportional width alignment is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralAlignment.Tabular
member.summary: Tabular alignment is used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle
member.summary: Describes a numeral style value for the Typography.NumeralStyle attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle.Lining
member.summary: Lining numeral style is used. Replaces default glyphs with numeric forms of even height.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle.Normal
member.summary: Default numeral style is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle.OldStyle
member.summary: Old style numeral style is used. Replaces default glyphs with a figure style that matches lowercase letters in height and color.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants
member.summary: Describes a font variant value for the Typography.Variants attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Inferior
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with an inferior glyph, or it may combine glyph substitution with positioning adjustments for proper placement. Inferior forms are typically used in chemical formulas or mathematical notation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Normal
member.summary: Default font behavior. Font scaling and positioning is normal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Ordinal
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with an ordinal glyph, or it may combine glyph substitution with positioning adjustments for proper placement. Ordinal forms are normally associated with numeric notation of an ordinal word, such as "1st" for "first".

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Ruby
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a smaller Japanese Kana glyph. This is used to clarify the meaning of Kanji, which may be unfamiliar to the reader.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Subscript
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a subscript glyph.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Superscript
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a superscript glyph. Superscript is commonly used for footnotes.

member.summary: The end of the text is aligned to the edge of the container.

member.summary: Text is justified within the container.

member.summary: Text is aligned to the left edge of the container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextAlignment.Right
member.summary: Text is aligned to the right edge of the container.

member.summary: The beginning of the text is aligned to the edge of the container.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds
member.summary: Influences how a line box height is calculated

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.Full
member.summary: Uses normal line box height calculation, this is the default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.Tight
member.summary: Top of line box height is the cap height from the font, bottom of line box height is the text baseline.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.TrimToBaseline
member.summary: Bottom of line box height is the text baseline.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.TrimToCapHeight
member.summary: Top of line box height is the cap height from the font.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder
member.summary: Provides a value for **TextReadingOrder** properties.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder.Default
member.summary: Do not detect flow direction from content. Use FlowDirection value (if any) for reading order decisions. (WindowsÂ 8.1)
member.deprecated: Consider using UseFlowDirection, which is an improved version of Default. For more info, see MSDN.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder.DetectFromContent
member.summary: Detect flow direction from text content. For bidirectional text, text containers will infer the reading order for text based on the content. See Remarks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder.UseFlowDirection
member.summary: Do not detect flow direction from content. Use FlowDirection value (if any) for reading order decisions. (Starting with WindowsÂ 10)

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming
member.summary: Describes how text is trimmed when it overflows the edge of its containing box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.CharacterEllipsis
member.summary: **Introduced in .** Text is trimmed at a character boundary. An ellipsis (...) is drawn in place of remaining text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.Clip
member.summary: **Introduced in .** Text is trimmed at a pixel level, visually clipping the excess glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.None
member.summary: Text is not trimmed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.WordEllipsis
member.summary: Text is trimmed at a word boundary. An ellipsis (...) is drawn in place of remaining text.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping
member.summary: Specifies whether text wraps when it reaches the edge of its container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping.NoWrap
member.summary: No line wrapping is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping.Wrap
member.summary: Line breaking occurs if a line of text overflows beyond the available width of its container. Line breaking occurs even if the text logic can't determine any line break opportunity. For example, if a very long word is constrained in a fixed-width container that can't scroll, it will wrap at a point that might be in the middle of a word.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping.WrapWholeWords
member.summary: **Introduced in .** Line-breaking occurs if the line overflows beyond the available block width. A line may overflow beyond the block width if the text logic can't determine a line break opportunity. For example, if a very long word is constrained in a fixed-width container that can't scroll, it will overflow the long word and continue the text after the long word on the next line. Not supported by all controls; see Remarks.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.GettingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before a UIElement receives focus. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.GotFocus
member.summary: Occurs when a UIElement receives focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus can move again before bubbling is complete.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Holding
member.summary: Occurs when an otherwise unhandled **Hold** interaction occurs over the hit test area of this element.

member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is pressed while the UIElement has focus.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.KeyUp
member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is released while the UIElement has focus.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.LosingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before a UIElement loses focus. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.LostFocus
member.summary: Occurs when a UIElement loses focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus can move again before bubbling is complete.

member.summary: Occurs when a manipulation on the UIElement is complete.

member.summary: Occurs when the input device loses contact with the UIElement object during a manipulation and inertia begins.

member.summary: Occurs when an input device begins a manipulation on the UIElement.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationStarting
member.summary: Occurs when the manipulation processor is first created.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.NoFocusCandidateFound

member.summary: Occurs when a pointer that made contact abnormally loses contact.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerExited
member.summary: Occurs when a pointer leaves the hit test area of this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerPressed

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerReleased
member.summary: Occurs when the pointer device that previously initiated a **Press** action is released, while within this element. Note that the end of a **Press** action is not guaranteed to fire a PointerReleased event; other events may fire instead. For more info, see Remarks.

member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is pressed while the UIElement has focus.

member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is released while the UIElement has focus.

member.summary: Occurs when an otherwise unhandled **Tap** interaction occurs over the hit test area of this element.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AddHandler(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.RoutedEvent,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a routed event handler for a specified routed event, adding the handler to the handler collection on the current element. Specify *handledEventsToo* as **true** to have the provided handler be invoked even if the event is handled elsewhere.
member.param: An identifier for the routed event to be handled.
A reference to the handler implementation.
**true** to register the handler such that it is invoked even when the routed event is marked handled in its event data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Arrange(Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Positions child objects and determines a size for a UIElement. Parent objects that implement custom layout for their child elements should call this method from their layout override implementations to form a recursive layout update.
member.param: The final size that the parent computes for the child in layout, provided as a Rect value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.CancelDirectManipulations
member.summary: Cancels ongoing direct manipulation processing (system-defined panning/zooming) on any ScrollViewer parent that contains the current UIElement.
member.returns: **true** if a ScrollViewer parent exists and setting the value resulted in canceling the panning/zooming action. **false** if calling the method results in no action.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.CapturePointer(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.Pointer)
member.summary: Sets pointer capture to a UIElement. Once captured, only the element that has capture will fire pointer-related events.
member.param: The pointer object reference.
member.returns: **true** if the object has pointer capture; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.FindSubElementsForTouchTargeting(Windows.Foundation.Point,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Enables a UIElement subclass to expose child elements that assist with resolving touch targeting.
member.param: The point being touched.
The bounds used for touch tolerance.
member.returns: A set of point sets. These represent the vertices of sub elements that are intersected by the given touch point (plus tolerance).

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.GetChildrenInTabFocusOrder
member.summary: Enables a UIElement subclass to expose child elements that take part in Tab focus.
member.returns: A collection of the UIElement's child elements that take part in Tab focus.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.InvalidateArrange
member.summary: Invalidates the arrange state (layout) for a UIElement. After the invalidation, the UIElement will have its layout updated, which will occur asynchronously.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.InvalidateMeasure
member.summary: Invalidates the measurement state (layout) for a UIElement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Measure(Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Updates the DesiredSize of a UIElement. Typically, objects that implement custom layout for their layout children call this method from their own MeasureOverride implementations to form a recursive layout update.
member.param: The available space that a parent can allocate to a child object. A child object can request a larger space than what is available; the provided size might be accommodated if scrolling or other resize behavior is possible in that particular container.

member.summary: Called before the BringIntoViewRequested event occurs.
member.param: The data for the event.

member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, returns class-specific AutomationPeer implementations for the Microsoft UI Automation infrastructure.
member.returns: The class-specific AutomationPeer subclass to return.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount
member.summary: Contains values that are used by the IScrollProvider pattern to indicate the direction and distance to scroll.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.LargeDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in large decrements, which is equivalent to pressing the PAGE UP key or to clicking a blank part of a scrollbar. If the distance represented by the PAGE UP key is not a relevant amount for the control, or if no scrollbar exists, the value represents an amount equal to the size of the currently visible window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.LargeIncrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in large increments, which is equivalent to pressing the PAGE DOWN key or to clicking a blank part of a scrollbar. If the distance represented by the PAGE DOWN key is not a relevant amount for the control, or if no scrollbar exists, the value represents an amount equal to the size of the currently visible region.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.NoAmount
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling should not be performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.SmallDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in small decrements, which is equivalent to pressing an arrow key or to clicking the arrow button on a scrollbar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.SmallIncrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in small increments, which is equivalent to pressing an arrow key or to clicking the arrow button on a scrollbar.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollPatternIdentifiers
member.summary: Contains values used as identifiers by IScrollProvider, and also contains the NoScroll constant.

member.summary: Identifies the HorizontallyScrollable automation property.
member.returns: The automation property identifier.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting
member.summary: Describes the notification characteristics of a particular live region in an app UI. Used by GetLiveSetting and AutomationProperties.LiveSetting.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Assertive
member.summary: The element sends interruptive notifications if the content of the live region has changed. With this setting, Microsoft UI Automation clients and assistive technology are expected to interrupt the user to inform of changes to the live region.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Off
member.summary: The element does not send notifications if the content of the live region has changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Polite
member.summary: The element sends non-interruptive notifications if the content of the live region has changed. With this setting, Microsoft UI Automation clients and assistive technology are expected to not interrupt the user to inform of changes to the live region.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind
member.summary: Indicates the type of notification when calling RaiseNotificationEvent

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.ActionAborted
member.summary: The current element has a notification that an action was abandoned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.ActionCompleted
member.summary: The current element has a notification that an action was completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.ItemAdded
member.summary: The current element container has had something added to it that should be presented to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.ItemRemoved
member.summary: The current element has had something removed from inside it that should be presented to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.Other
member.summary: The current element has a notification not an add, remove, completed, or aborted action.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing
member.summary: Specifies the order in which to process a notification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.All
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. All of the notifications from this source should be delivered to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.CurrentThenMostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. Donât interrupt the current notification for this one. If new notifications come in from the same source while the current notification is being presented, then keep the most recent and ignore the rest until the current processing is completed. Then use the most recent message as the current message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.ImportantAll
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user as soon as possible. All of the notifications from this source should be delivered to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.ImportantMostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user as soon as possible. The most recent notifications from this source should be delivered to the user because the most recent notification supersedes all of the other notifications.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.MostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. Interrupt the current notification for this one.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation

member.summary: The control is presented horizontally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation.None
member.summary: The control does not have an orientation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation.Vertical
member.summary: The control is presented vertically.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDragProvider
member.summary: Enables a Microsoft UI Automation element to describe itself as an element that can be dragged as part of a drag-and-drop operation. Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a GetPattern call and PatternInterface.Drag.

member.summary: Gets a string that indicates what will happen when the item is dropped.

member.summary: Gets an array of strings that enumerates possible drop effects when this item is dropped.
member.returns: An array of strings that enumerates possible drop effects when this item is dropped.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDragProvider.IsGrabbed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an item is currently being dragged.
member.returns: **true** if the item is being dragged. Otherwise, **false**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDragProvider.GetGrabbedItems
member.summary: Gets an array of UI Automation elements that are being dragged as part of this drag operation.
member.returns: An array of UI Automation elements that are being dragged. Null if this item is an individual item being dragged. Used to enable providers that support dragging multiple items at a time to create an intermediary IDragProvider that encapsulates all of the items being dragged.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDropTargetProvider

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDropTargetProvider.DropEffect
member.summary: Gets a string that indicates what will happen when the item is dropped.

member.summary: Gets an array of strings that enumerates possible drop effects when this item is dropped.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IInvokeProvider

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IInvokeProvider.Invoke

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IItemContainerProvider

The property that contains the value to retrieve.

member.returns: The first item that matches the search criterion; otherwise, null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollItemProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by Microsoft UI Automation client to individual child controls of containers that implement IScrollProvider. Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a GetPattern call and PatternInterface.ScrollItem.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollItemProvider.ScrollIntoView
member.summary: Scrolls the content area of a container object in order to display the control within the visible region (viewport) of the container.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by a Microsoft UI Automation client to a control that acts as a scrollable container for a collection of child objects. The children of this element must implement IScrollItemProvider. Implement IScrollProvider in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a GetPattern call and PatternInterface.Scroll.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.HorizontallyScrollable
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control can scroll horizontally.
member.returns: **true** if the control can scroll horizontally; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.HorizontalScrollPercent
member.summary: Gets the current horizontal scroll position.
member.returns: The horizontal scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.HorizontalViewSize
member.summary: Gets the current horizontal view size.
member.returns: The horizontal size of the viewable region as a percentage of the total content area within the control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.VerticallyScrollable
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control can scroll vertically.
member.returns: **true** if the control can scroll vertically; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.VerticalScrollPercent
member.summary: Gets the current vertical scroll position.
member.returns: The vertical scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.VerticalViewSize
member.summary: Gets the vertical view size.
member.returns: The vertical size of the viewable region as a percentage of the total content area within the control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.Scroll(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount)
member.summary: Scrolls the visible region of the content area horizontally, vertically, or both.
member.param: The horizontal increment that is specific to the control. Pass NoScroll if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
The vertical increment that is specific to the control. Pass NoScroll if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.SetScrollPercent(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the horizontal and vertical scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.
member.param: The horizontal position as a percentage of the content area's total range. Pass NoScroll if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
The vertical position as a percentage of the content area's total range. Pass NoScroll if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider

member.summary: Removes the current element from the collection of selected items.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider.Select

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the Microsoft UI Automation provider allows more than one child element to be selected concurrently.

member.summary: Retrieves a UI Automation provider for each child element that is selected.

The target range for comparison.
The **Start** or **End** endpoint of the target.
member.returns: Returns a negative value if the caller's endpoint occurs earlier in the text than the target endpoint. Returns zero if the caller's endpoint is at the same location as the target endpoint. Returns a positive value if the caller's endpoint occurs later in the text than the target endpoint.

member.summary: Retrieves the plain text of the range.
member.param: The maximum length of the string to return. Use â 1 to specify an unlimited length.
member.returns: The plain text of the text range, which might represent a portion of the full string truncated at the specified *maxLength*.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider.Move(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Text.TextUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the text range the specified number of text units.
member.param: The text unit boundary.
The number of text units to move. A positive value moves the text range forward; a negative value moves the text range backward; and a value of 0 has no effect.
member.returns: The number of units actually moved. This value can be less than the *count* requested if either of the new text range endpoints is greater than or less than the DocumentRange endpoints. This value can be negative if navigation is happening in the backward direction.

member.param: The endpoint to move.

An endpoint on the other range.

member.summary: Moves one endpoint of the text range the specified number of text units within the document range.
member.param: The endpoint to move.
The text measure unit for moving.
The number of units to move. A positive value moves the endpoint forward. A negative value moves it backward. A value of 0 has no effect.
member.returns: The number of units actually moved, which can be less than the number requested if moving the endpoint runs into the beginning or end of the document.

member.summary: When the hardware keyboard is used, the Input Method Editor (IME) aligns to the bottom edge and left side of the text edit control. When the Soft Input Panel (SIP) is used, the Input Method Editor (IME) is docked to the Soft Input Panel (SIP).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.CandidateWindowAlignment.Default
member.summary: When the hardware keyboard is used, the Input Method Editor (IME) follows the cursor. When the Soft Input Panel (SIP) is used, the Input Method Editor (IME) is docked to the Soft Input Panel (SIP).
