member.summary: Specifies that the Click event should be raised when the mouse pointer moves over the control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ClickMode.Press
member.summary: Specifies that the Click event should be raised when the mouse button is pressed and the mouse pointer is over the control. If you are using the keyboard, specifies that the Click event should be raised when the SPACEBAR or ENTER key is pressed and the control has keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ClickMode.Release
member.summary: Specifies that the Click event should be raised when the left mouse button is pressed and released, and the mouse pointer is over the control. If you are using the keyboard, specifies that the Click event should be raised when the SPACEBAR or ENTER key is pressed and released, and the control has keyboard focus.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.Navigate(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName)
member.summary: Causes the Frame to load content represented by the specified Page.
member.param: The page to navigate to, specified as a type reference to its partial class type. (A type reference is given as System.Type for Microsoft .NET, or a TypeName helper struct for VisualÂ C++ component extensions (C++/CX)).
member.returns: **false** if a NavigationFailed event handler has set Handled to **true**; otherwise, **true**. See Remarks for more info.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.Navigate(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,System.Object)
member.summary: Causes the Frame to load content represented by the specified Page, also passing a parameter to be interpreted by the target of the navigation.
member.param: The page to navigate to, specified as a type reference to its partial class type. (A type reference is given as System.Type for Microsoft .NET, or a TypeName helper struct for VisualÂ C++ component extensions (C++/CX)).
The navigation parameter to pass to the target page; must have a basic type (string, char, numeric, or GUID) to support parameter serialization using GetNavigationState.
member.returns: **false** if a NavigationFailed event handler has set Handled to **true**; otherwise, **true**. See Remarks for more info.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.Navigate(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,System.Object,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.NavigationTransitionInfo)
member.summary: Causes the Frame to load content represented by the specified Page -derived data type, also passing a parameter to be interpreted by the target of the navigation, and a value indicating the animated transition to use.
member.param: The page to navigate to, specified as a type reference to its partial class type. (A type reference is given as System.Type for Microsoft .NET, or a TypeName helper struct for VisualÂ C++ component extensions (C++/CX)).
The navigation parameter to pass to the target page; must have a basic type (string, char, numeric, or GUID) to support parameter serialization using GetNavigationState.
Info about the animated transition.
member.returns: **false** if a NavigationFailed event handler has set Handled to **true**; otherwise, **true**. See Remarks for more info.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.NavigateToType(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,System.Object,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Navigation.FrameNavigationOptions)
member.summary: Causes the Frame to load content represented by the specified Page, also passing a parameter to be interpreted by the target of the navigation.
member.param: The page to navigate to, specified as a type reference to its partial class type. (A type reference is given as System.Type for Microsoft .NET, or a TypeName helper struct for VisualÂ C++ component extensions (C++/CX)).
The navigation parameter to pass to the target page; must have a basic type (string, char, numeric, or GUID) to support parameter serialization using GetNavigationState.
Options for the navigation, including whether it is recorded in the navigation stack and what transition animation is used.
member.returns: **false** if a NavigationFailed event handler has set Handled to **true**; otherwise, **true**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.SetNavigationState(System.String)
member.summary: Reads and restores the navigation history of a Frame from a provided serialization string.
member.param: The serialization string that supplies the restore point for navigation history.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.SetNavigationState(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads and restores the navigation history of a Frame from a provided serialization string.
member.param: The serialization string that supplies the restore point for navigation history.
**true** to restore navigation history without navigating to the current page; otherwise, **false**.

member.summary: Defines constants that specify whether the back button is visible in NavigationView.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NavigationViewBackButtonVisible.Auto
member.summary: The system chooses whether or not to display the back button, depending on the device/form factor. On phones, tablets, desktops, and hubs, the back button is visible. On Xbox/TV, the back button is collapsed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NavigationViewBackButtonVisible.Visible
member.summary: Display the back button in NavigationView.

member.summary: The pane always shows as a narrow sliver which can be opened to full width.

member.summary: The pane stays open alongside the content.

member.summary: Invoked immediately before the Page is unloaded and is no longer the current source of a parent Frame.
member.param: Event data that can be examined by overriding code. The event data is representative of the navigation that will unload the current Page unless canceled. The navigation can potentially be canceled by setting Cancel.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility
member.summary: Defines constants that specify the visibility of a scrollbar within a ScrollViewer control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Auto
member.summary: A ScrollBar appears only when the viewport cannot display all of the content.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Disabled
member.summary: A ScrollBar does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content. Scrolling is disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Hidden
member.summary: A ScrollBar does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content. Scrolling is still enabled, and can occur through touch, keyboard, or mouse wheel interaction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Visible
member.summary: A ScrollBar always appears.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.BringIntoViewOnFocusChange

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ChangeView(Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Single})
member.summary: Causes the ScrollViewer to load a new view into the viewport using the specified offsets and zoom factor.
member.param: A value between 0 and ScrollableWidth that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled horizontally.
A value between 0 and ScrollableHeight that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled vertically.
A value between MinZoomFactor and MaxZoomFactor that specifies the required target ZoomFactor.
member.returns: **true** if the view is changed; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ChangeView(Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Single},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Causes the ScrollViewer to load a new view into the viewport using the specified offsets and zoom factor, and optionally disables scrolling animation.
member.param: A value between 0 and ScrollableWidth that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled horizontally.
A value between 0 and ScrollableHeight that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled vertically.
A value between MinZoomFactor and MaxZoomFactor that specifies the required target ZoomFactor.
**true** to disable zoom/pan animations while changing the view; otherwise, **false**. The default is **false**.
member.returns: **true** if the view is changed; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ScrollToHorizontalOffset(System.Double)
member.summary: Scrolls the content that is within the ScrollViewer to the specified horizontal offset position.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom
member.summary: Represents a scrollable control that incorporates two views that have a semantic relationship. For example, the ZoomedOutView might be an index of titles, and the ZoomedInView might include details and summaries for each of the title entries. Views can be changed using zoom or other interactions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how panning snap points are processed for gesture/manipulation input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.Mandatory
member.summary: Content always stops at the snap point closest to where inertia would naturally stop along the direction of inertia.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.MandatorySingle
member.summary: Content always stops at the snap point closest to the release point along the direction of inertia.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.None
member.summary: No snapping behavior. Only the manipulation influences the final location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.Optional
member.summary: Content stops at a snap point closest to where inertia would naturally stop along the direction of inertia, depending on how close the snap point is.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.OptionalSingle
member.summary: Content stops at the next snap point, if the motion starts far from it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how the pane is shown in a SplitView.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.CompactInline
member.summary: The amount of the pane defined by the CompactPaneLength property is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout. The remaining part of the pane pushes the content to the side when it's open and takes up space in the control layout. The pane does not close when the user taps outside of it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.CompactOverlay
member.summary: The amount of the pane defined by the CompactPaneLength property is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout. The remaining part of the pane covers the content when it's open and does not take up space in the control layout. The pane closes when the user taps outside of it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.Inline
member.summary: The pane is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout. The pane does not close when the user taps outside of it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.Overlay
member.summary: The pane covers the content when it's open and does not take up space in the control layout. The pane closes when the user taps outside of it.

member.summary: The pane is shown to the right of the SplitView content .

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapCamera
member.summary: Represents the position of a camera to define the view of a map.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapCamera.#ctor(Windows.Devices.Geolocation.Geopoint)
member.summary: Creates a map camera, to define the view of a map based on location.
member.param: The location of the camera in the map.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapCamera.#ctor(Windows.Devices.Geolocation.Geopoint,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a map camera, to define the view of a map based on location and heading.
member.param: The location of the camera in the map.
The directional heading of the camera in degrees, where 0 or 360 = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, and 270 = West. The default *headingInDegrees* value is 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapCamera.#ctor(Windows.Devices.Geolocation.Geopoint,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a map camera, to define the view of a map based on location, heading, and pitch.
member.param: The location of the camera in the map.
The directional heading of the camera in degrees, where 0 or 360 = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, and 270 = West. The default *headingInDegrees* value is 0.
The pitch of the map's camera in degrees, where 90 is looking out at the horizon (maximum) and 0 is looking straight down (minimum). The default *pitchInDegrees* value is 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapCamera.#ctor(Windows.Devices.Geolocation.Geopoint,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a map camera, to define the view of a map based on location, heading, pitch, roll, and field of view.
member.param: The location of the camera in the map.
The directional heading of the camera in degrees, where 0 or 360 = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, and 270 = West. The default *headingInDegrees* value is 0.
The pitch of the map's camera in degrees, where 90 is looking out at the horizon (maximum) and 0 is looking straight down (minimum). The default *pitchInDegrees* value is 0.
The roll of the camera in degrees, where -90 is tilting to the left and +90 is tilting to the right. The default *rollInDegrees* value is 0.
The horizontal angle of view that appears in the camera, in degrees. The default *fieldOfViewInDegrees* value is 45.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapCamera.FieldOfView
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical angle of view that appears in the camera, in degrees.
member.returns: The vertical angle of view that appears in the camera, in degrees.

member.summary: Map responds to the UI control only; the corresponding touch input is disabled.

member.summary: Map UI control and touch input are disabled.

member.summary: Map UI control and touch input are enabled. Pointer and keyboard are not.

member.summary: Map responds to touch input only; the corresponding UI control is not visible. Use PointerAndKeyboard, if you want all forms of pointer input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapInteractionMode.PointerAndKeyboard
member.summary: Map responds to mouse, pen, touch and keyboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapInteractionMode.PointerKeyboardAndControl
member.summary: All forms of input are enabled including mouse, pen, touch, keyboard, and Map UI control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapInteractionMode.PointerOnly
member.summary: Map responds to mouse, pen, or touch only.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapScene.CreateFromBoundingBox(Windows.Devices.Geolocation.GeoboundingBox)
member.summary: Creates a scene to appear in a map based on a four-sided geographic area.
member.param: The four-sided geographic area to appear in the scene.
member.returns: Represents a view of a map in the MapControl.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapScene.CreateFromBoundingBox(Windows.Devices.Geolocation.GeoboundingBox,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a scene to appear in a map based on a four-sided geographic area, heading, and pitch.
member.param: The four-sided geographic area to appear in the scene.
The directional heading of the map's camera in degrees, where 0 or 360 = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, and 270 = West. The default *headingInDegrees* value is 0.
The pitch of the map's camera in degrees, where 90 is looking out at the horizon (maximum) and 0 is looking straight down (minimum). The default *pitchInDegrees* value is 0.
member.returns: Represents a view of a map in the MapControl.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapScene.CreateFromCamera(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.MapCamera)
member.summary: Creates a scene to appear in a map based on the position of the specified MapCamera.
member.param: The current position of the specified camera.
member.returns: Represents a view of a map in the MapControl.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.StreetsideExperience
member.summary: Represents a custom map experience that provides a street-level view of a geographic location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.StreetsideExperience.#ctor(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.StreetsidePanorama)
member.summary: Creates a StreetsideExperience based on the specified panoramic view.
member.param: The panoramic view to appear in the StreetsideExperience.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.StreetsideExperience.#ctor(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps.StreetsidePanorama,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a StreetsideExperience based on the specified panoramic view and camera position.
member.param: The panoramic view to appear in the StreetsideExperience.
The directional heading of the map's camera in degrees, where 0 or 360 = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, and 270 = West. The default *headingInDegrees* value is 0.
The pitch of the map's camera in degrees, where 90 is looking out at the horizon (maximum) and 0 is looking straight down (minimum). The default *pitchInDegrees* value is 90.
The horizontal angle of view that appears in the map's camera, in degrees. The default *fieldOfViewInDegrees* value is 75.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.Auto
member.summary: The show mode is determined automatically based on the method used to show the flyout.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.Standard
member.summary: Behavior is typical of a flyout shown reactively, like a context menu. The open flyout takes focus. For a CommandBarFlyout, it opens in it's expanded state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.Transient
member.summary: Behavior is typical of a flyout shown proactively. The open flyout does not take focus. For a CommandBarFlyout, it opens in it's collapsed state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.TransientWithDismissOnPointerMoveAway
member.summary: The flyout exhibits Transient behavior while the cursor is close to it, but is dismissed when the cursor moves away.

member.summary: Provides the appropriate background Brush for elements in the item template of a jump list to bind to. The Brush reflects the current theme and accent color, and it's also used to shade empty-group jump list items. By default, the Brush matches built-in apps, but you can override that to suit your design needs using the Enabled and Disabled properties.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode
member.summary: Defines constants that specify the preferred location for positioning a ToolTip relative to a visual element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Bottom
member.summary: The preferred location of the ToolTip is below the target element when element receives keyboard focus, at the bottom of the mouse pointer when element is hovered over with pointer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Left
member.summary: The preferred location of the ToolTip is to the left of the target element when element receives keyboard focus, to the left of the mouse pointer when element is hovered over with pointer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Mouse
member.summary: The preferred location of the ToolTip is with the top-left corner of the tooltip positioned at the mouse pointer location when hovered over with mouse, above the target element when focused with keyboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Right
member.summary: The preferred location of the ToolTip is to the right of the target element when element receives keyboard focus, to the right of the mouse pointer when element is hovered over with pointer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Top
member.summary: The preferred location of the ToolTip is above the target element when element receives keyboard focus, at the top of the mouse pointer when element is hovered over with pointer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType
member.summary: Defines constants that specify the type of Scroll event that occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.EndScroll
member.summary: The Thumb was dragged to a new position and is now no longer being dragged by the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.First
member.summary: The Thumb moved to the Minimum position of the ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.LargeDecrement
member.summary: The Thumb moved a distance specified by the value of LargeChange. The Thumb moved to the left for a horizontal ScrollBar or upward for a vertical ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.LargeIncrement
member.summary: The Thumb moved a distance specified by the value of LargeChange. The Thumb moved to the right for a horizontal ScrollBar or downward for a vertical ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.Last
member.summary: The Thumb moved to the Maximum position of the ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.SmallDecrement
member.summary: The Thumb moved a distance specified by the value of SmallChange. The Thumb moved to the left for a horizontal ScrollBar or upward for a vertical ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.SmallIncrement
member.summary: The Thumb moved a distance specified by the value of SmallChange. The Thumb moved to the right for a horizontal ScrollBar or downward for a vertical ScrollBar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.ThumbPosition

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.BindingOperations.SetBinding(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.BindingBase)
member.summary: Associates a Binding with a target property on a target object. This method is the code equivalent to using a {Binding} markup extension in XAML markup.
member.param: The object that should be the target of the evaluated binding.

The property on the target to bind, specified by its identifier. These identifiers are usually available as static read-only properties on the type that defines the *target* object, or one of its base types. You can also bind to attached properties, but see Remarks.
The binding to assign to the target property. This Binding should be initialized: important Binding properties such as Path should already be set before passing it as the parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.UpdateSourceTrigger.Explicit
member.summary: The binding source is updated only when you call the BindingExpression.UpdateSource method.

member.summary: The binding source is updated whenever the binding target value changes. This is detected automatically by the binding system.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.ElementCompositionPreview.SetImplicitHideAnimation(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement,Microsoft.UI.Composition.ICompositionAnimationBase)
member.summary: Associates the specified hide animation with a UIElement.
member.param: The UIElement to associate the animation with.
The animation to play when the UIElement is hidden. A **Null** value prevents hide animations from playing for this element until the method is called again with an animation value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.ElementCompositionPreview.SetImplicitShowAnimation(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement,Microsoft.UI.Composition.ICompositionAnimationBase)
member.summary: Associates the specified show animation with a UIElement.
member.param: The UIElement to associate the animation with.
The animation to play when the UIElement is shown. A **Null** value prevents show animations from playing for this element until the method is called again with an animation value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.ElementCompositionPreview.SetIsTranslationEnabled(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Toggles the ability to set, animate, and use a render-time post-layout translate transform to position XAML elements on screen using Composition APIs.
member.param: The element on which to enable or disable translate transforms.
**true** to enable translate transforms; **false** to disable translate transforms.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.AccessKeyInvokedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the routed event as handled. A **true** value for Handled prevents most handlers along the event route from handling the same event again.
member.returns: **true** to mark the routed event handled. **false** to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further and be acted on by other handlers. The default is **false**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ContextRequestedEventArgs.TryGetPosition(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement,Windows.Foundation.Point@)
member.summary: Gets the x- and y-coordinates of the pointer position, optionally evaluated against a coordinate origin of a supplied UIElement.
member.param: Any UIElement -derived object that is connected to the same object tree. To specify the object relative to the overall coordinate system, use a *relativeTo* Â value ofÂ **null**.

A Point that represents the current x- and y-coordinates of the mouse pointer position. If **null** was passed as *relativeTo*, this coordinate is for the overall window. If a *relativeTo* value other than **null** was passed, this coordinate is relative to the object referenced by *relativeTo*.
member.returns: **true** if the context request was initiated by a pointer device; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager
member.summary: A helper class that enables global management of focus actions and events across all elements in an application.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.GettingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before an element actually receives focus. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.GotFocus
member.summary: Occurs when an element within a container element (a focus scope) receives focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus might move before bubbling is complete.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.LosingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before focus moves from the current element with focus to the target element. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.LostFocus
member.summary: Occurs when an element within a container element (a focus scope) loses focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus might move again before bubbling is complete.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindFirstFocusableElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Retrieves the first element that can receive focus based on the specified scope.
member.param: The root object from which to search. If **null**, the search scope is the current window.
member.returns: The first focusable object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindLastFocusableElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Retrieves the last element that can receive focus based on the specified scope.
member.param: The root object from which to search. If **null**, the search scope is the current window.
member.returns: The last focusable object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.
member.returns: The next object to receive focus.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FindNextElementOptions)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction (cannot be used with tab navigation, see remarks).
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.
The options to help identify the next element to receive focus with keyboard/controller/remote navigation.
member.returns: The next object to receive focus.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextFocusableElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the application UI.
member.returns: **null** if focus cannot be set in the specified direction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextFocusableElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction and hint rectangle.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.
A bounding rectangle used to influence which element is most likely to be considered the next to receive focus. Examples where this can be useful include:
member.returns: **null** if focus cannot be set in the specified direction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.GetFocusedElement
member.summary: Retrieves the element in the UI that has focus.
member.returns: The object that has focus. Typically, this is a Control class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.TryFocusAsync(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FocusState)
member.summary: Asynchronously attempts to set focus on an element when the application is initialized.
member.param: The object on which to set focus.
One of the values from the FocusState enumeration that specify how an elemnent can obtain focus.
member.returns: The FocusMovementResult that indicates whether focus was successfully set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.TryMoveFocus(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection)
member.summary: Attempts to change focus from the element with focus to the next focusable element in the specified direction.
member.param: The direction to traverse (in tab order).
member.returns: **true** if focus moved; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.TryMoveFocus(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FindNextElementOptions)
member.summary: Attempts to change focus from the element with focus to the next focusable element in the specified direction, using the specified navigation options.
member.param: The direction to traverse (in tab order).
The options to help identify the next element to receive focus with keyboard/controller/remote navigation.
member.returns: **true** if focus moved; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.TryMoveFocusAsync(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection)
member.summary: Asynchronously attempts to change focus from the current element with focus to the next focusable element in the specified direction.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.
member.returns: The FocusMovementResult that indicates whether focus was successfully set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.TryMoveFocusAsync(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FindNextElementOptions)
member.summary: Asynchronously attempts to change focus from the current element with focus to the next focusable element in the specified direction and subject to the specified navigation options.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.
The navigation options used to identify the focus candidate.
member.returns: The FocusMovementResult that indicates whether focus was successfully set.

member.returns: **true** to mark the routed event handled. **false** to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further and be acted on by other handlers. The default is **false**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.IsGenerated
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pointer event occurred from direct interaction with an object by the user, or was generated by the platform based on changes to the UI of the application.
member.returns: True if the event was generated by the platform; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.KeyModifiers
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates which key modifiers were active at the time that the pointer event was initiated.
member.returns: A value or values of the enumeration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.Pointer
member.summary: Gets a reference to a pointer token.
member.returns: A pointer token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.GetCurrentPoint(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a PointerPoint object that provides basic info on the pointer associated with the event.
member.param: Any UIElement -derived object that is connected to the same object tree. To specify the object relative to the overallÂ coordinate system, use a *relativeTo* Â value ofÂ **null**.
member.returns: A PointerPoint value that represents the pointer point associated with this event. If **null** was passed as *relativeTo*, the coordinates are in the frame of reference of the overall window. If a *relativeTo* value other than **null** was passed, the coordinates are relative to the object referenced by *relativeTo*.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.GetIntermediatePoints(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of PointerPoint objects that represent the pointer history from the last pointer event up to and including the current pointer event. Each PointerPoint in the collection provides basic info on the pointer associated with the event.The last item in the collection is equivalent to the PointerPoint object returned by GetCurrentPoint.
member.param: Provides the context for the pointer data. Can be any UIElement -derived object that is connected to the same object tree. If **null**, location coordinates are in the context of the app.
member.returns: The collection of PointerPoint objects corresponding to the pointer history associated with the event. If *relativeTo* is **null**, location coordinates are in the context of the app. Otherwise, the coordinates are relative to the object referenced by *relativeTo*.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.RightTappedRoutedEventArgs.GetPosition(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Returns the x- and y-coordinates of the pointer position, optionally evaluated against a coordinate origin of a supplied UIElement.
member.param: Any UIElement -derived object that is connected to the same object tree. To specify the object relative to the overallÂ coordinate system, use a *relativeTo* Â value ofÂ **null**.
member.returns: A Point that represents the current x- and y-coordinates of the mouse pointer position. If **null** was passed as *relativeTo*, this coordinate is for the overall window. If a *relativeTo* value other than **null** was passed, this coordinate is relative to the object referenced by *relativeTo*.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode
member.summary: Specifies the 2D directional navigation behavior when using the keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode.Auto
member.summary: Behavior is inherited from the elements ancestors. If all ancestors have a value of **Auto**, the fallback behavior is **Disabled**.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode.Disabled
member.summary: Arrow keys cannot be used for 2D directional navigation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode.Enabled
member.summary: Arrow keys can be used for 2D directional navigation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy
member.summary: Specifies the disambiguation strategy used for navigating between multiple candidate targets using XYFocusDownNavigationStrategy, XYFocusLeftNavigationStrategy, XYFocusRightNavigationStrategy, and XYFocusUpNavigationStrategy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.Auto
member.summary: Indicates that navigation strategy is inherited from the element's ancestors. If all ancestors have a value of **Auto**, the fallback strategy is **Projection**.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.NavigationDirectionDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the element closest to the axis of the navigation direction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.Projection
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the first element encountered when projecting the edge of the currently focused element in the direction of navigation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.RectilinearDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the closest element based on the shortest 2D distance (Manhattan metric).

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride
member.summary: Specifies how the XAML framework determines the target of an XY navigation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.Auto
member.summary: Indicates that navigation strategy is inherited from the element's ancestors. If all ancestors have a value of **Auto**, the fallback strategy is **Projection**.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.NavigationDirectionDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the element closest to the axis of the navigation direction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.None
member.summary: No navigation override is applied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.Projection
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the first element encountered when projecting the edge of the currently focused element in the direction of navigation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.RectilinearDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the closest element based on the shortest 2D distance (Manhattan metric).

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.AudioCategory
member.summary: Describes the purpose of the audio information in an audio stream. Used as a value by AudioCategory.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.AudioCategory.Alerts
member.summary: Audio is for system or application notifications, for example ring tones.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.AudioCategory.BackgroundCapableMedia
member.summary: Audio is for general media, for example audio for video, or streaming audio, and can be played as background. This enumeration value is deprecated. For more information, see **Remarks**.
member.deprecated: BackgroundCapableMedia is deprecated and might not work on all platforms. For more info, see MSDN.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.AudioCategory.Communications
member.summary: Audio is for peer-to-peer communications, for example chat or VoIP.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.AudioCategory.ForegroundOnlyMedia

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.BrushMappingMode.RelativeToBoundingBox
member.summary: The coordinate system is relative to a bounding box: 0 indicates 0Â percent of the bounding box, and 1 indicates 100Â percent of the bounding box. For example, (0.5, 0.5) describes a point in the middle of the bounding box, and (1, 1) describes a point at the lower right of the bounding box.

member.summary: Defines constants that specify how MediaTransportControls fast-forward/backward buttons behave.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FastPlayFallbackBehaviour.Disable
member.summary: If the media doesn't support fast-forward/fast-rewind, the buttons are disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FastPlayFallbackBehaviour.Hide
member.summary: If the media doesn't support fast-forward/fast-rewind, the buttons are hidden.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FastPlayFallbackBehaviour.Skip
member.summary: If the media doesn't support fast-forward/fast-rewind, the media skips 30 seconds.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule
member.summary: Specifies how the intersecting areas of PathFigure objects contained in a Geometry are combined to form the area of the Geometry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments within the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule.Nonzero
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region of the path by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray. Starting with a count of zero, add one each time a segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a path segment crosses the ray from right to left. After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the path. Otherwise, it is inside.

member.summary: Media engine might support the media source.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState
member.summary: Defines the potential states of a MediaElement object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Buffering
member.summary: The MediaElement is loading the media for playback. Its Position does not advance during this state. If the MediaElement was already playing video, it continues to display the last displayed frame.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Closed
member.summary: The MediaElement contains no media. The MediaElement displays a transparent frame.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Opening
member.summary: The MediaElement is validating and attempting to load the specified source.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Paused
member.summary: The MediaElement does not advance its Position. If the MediaElement was playing video, it continues to display the current frame.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Playing
member.summary: The MediaElement is playing the current media source.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.MediaElementState.Stopped
member.summary: The MediaElement contains media but is not playing or paused. Its Position is 0 and does not advance. If the loaded media is video, the MediaElement displays the first frame.

member.summary: A cap that does not extend past the last point of the line. Comparable to no line cap.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Round
member.summary: A semicircle that has a diameter equal to the line thickness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Square
member.summary: A rectangle that has a height equal to the line thickness and a length equal to half the line thickness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Triangle
member.summary: An isosceles right triangle whose base length is equal to the thickness of the line.

member.summary: Line joins use beveled vertices.

member.summary: Line joins use regular angular vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineJoin.Round
member.summary: Line joins use rounded vertices.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PlaneProjection class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationX
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The x-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. Typical values are between 0 and 1 with a value of 0 corresponding to one edge of the object and 1 to the opposite edge. Values outside this range are allowed and move the center of rotation accordingly. The default is 0.5 (the center of object).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationXProperty
member.summary: Identifies the CenterOfRotationX Â dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the CenterOfRotationX Â dependency property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The y-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. Typical values are between 0 and 1 with a value of 0 corresponding to one edge of the object and 1 to the opposite edge. Values outside this range are allowed and move the center of rotation accordingly. The default is 0.5 (the center of object).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationZ
member.summary: Gets or sets the z-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The z-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. The default is 0. Values greater than 0 correspond to coordinates in front of the plane of the object, and negative values correspond to coordinates behind the plane of the object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper
member.summary: Provides utility methods that can be used to traverse object relationships (along child-object or parent-object axes) in the visual tree of your app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.DisconnectChildrenRecursive(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Explicitly removes all references from a target UIElement, with the goal of cleaning up reference cycles.
member.param: The target object to disconnect children and remove references from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Point,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified x-y coordinate point of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share that point.
member.param: The point to use as the determination point. This point is using the coordinate space of the app window, not of any specific element (and not of *subtree* if specified).

An object to search for. If the *subtree* object exists in the overall set of elements that exist at the specified *intersectingPoint* coordinates, then the return value contains only the *subtree* object and any objects that have a higher z-order than *subtree*, listed by inverse of z-order. If the *subtree* object doesn't exist at *intersectingPoint* coordinates, the return value will be empty.
member.returns: An enumerable set of UIElement objects in the visual tree composition at the specified point, listed by inverse of z-order.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Point,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified x-y coordinate point of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share that point.
member.param: The point to use as the determination point. This point is using the coordinate space of the app window, not of any specific element (and not of *subtree* if specified).

An object to search for. If the *subtree* object exists in the overall set of elements that exist at the specified *intersectingPoint* coordinates, then the return value contains only the *subtree* object and any objects that have a higher z-order than *subtree*, listed by inverse of z-order. If the *subtree* object doesn't exist at *intersectingPoint* coordinates, the return value will be empty.
**true** to include all elements that intersect, including those elements considered to be invisible to hit testing. **false** to find only visible, hit-testable elements. The default is **false**.
member.returns: An enumerable set of UIElement objects that are determined to be located in the visual tree composition at the specified point, listed by inverse of z-order.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Rect,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified Rect frame of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share a rectangular area, and might include elements that overdraw.
member.param: The Rect to use as the determination area. This frame is using the coordinate space of the app window, not of any specific element (and not of *subtree* if specified).

An object to search for. If the *subtree* object exists in the overall set of elements that exist within the specified *intersectingRect*, then the return value contains only the *subtree* object and elements that are drawing on top of its space. If the *subtree* object doesn't exist within the *intersectingRect* frame, the return value will be empty.
member.returns: An enumerable set of UIElement objects that are in the visual tree composition in the specified Rect frame.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Rect,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified Rect frame of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share a rectangular area, and might include elements that overdraw.
member.param: The Rect to use as the determination area. This frame is using the coordinate space of the app window, not of any specific element (and not of *subtree* if specified).

An object to search for. If the *subtree* object exists in the overall set of elements that exist within the specified *intersectingRect*, then the return value contains only the *subtree* object and elements that are drawing on top of its space. If the *subtree* object doesn't exist within the *intersectingRect* frame, the return value will be empty.
**true** to include all elements that intersect, including those elements considered to be invisible to hit testing. **false** to find only visible, hit-testable elements. The default is **false**.
member.returns: An enumerable set of UIElement objects that are determined to be located in the visual tree composition in the specified Rect frame.

member.summary: Describes how a Timeline repeats its simple duration.

member.summary: The number of times a Timeline should repeat.

member.summary: The time span for which a Timeline should repeat.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior.Type
member.summary: The mode or type of repeat behavior that this instance represents, as a value of the enumeration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper
member.summary: Provides basic utility methods for processing RepeatBehavior values. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use members of RepeatBehavior instead.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper.Forever
member.summary: Gets a static RepeatBehavior that represents the special "Forever" value. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use Forever instead.
member.returns: A static RepeatBehavior that represents the special "Forever" value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper.Equals(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior)
member.summary: Determines whether two RepeatBehavior values have equivalent values. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use the equality operator instead.
member.param: The first RepeatBehavior to compare.
The second RepeatBehavior to compare.
member.returns: **true** if *target* and *value* hold equivalent values; otherwise, **false**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper.FromCount(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new RepeatBehavior based on a repeat count. This corresponds to the *int***x** form when provided as XAML attribute value. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use RepeatBehavior(Double) instead.
member.param: The number of times that the target animation should repeat.
member.returns: The created RepeatBehavior, which has a **RepeatBehaviorType** of **Count**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper.FromDuration(Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a new RepeatBehavior based on a timespan. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use RepeatBehavior(TimeSpan) instead.
member.param: The time span that declares the desired repeat behavior.
member.returns: The created RepeatBehavior, which has a **RepeatBehaviorType** value of **Duration**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper.GetHasCount(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior)
member.summary: Returns whether a specified RepeatBehavior has a **RepeatBehaviorType** of **Count** and a nonzero **Count** value. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use HasCount instead.
member.param: The RepeatBehavior to evaluate.
member.returns: **true** if *target* has a **RepeatBehaviorType** of **Count** and a nonzero **Count** value. Otherwise, **false**.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper.GetHasDuration(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior)
member.summary: Returns whether a specified RepeatBehavior has a **RepeatBehaviorType** of **Duration** and a nonzero **Duration** value. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use HasDuration instead.
member.param: The RepeatBehavior to evaluate.
member.returns: **true** if *target* has a **RepeatBehaviorType** of **Duration** and a nonzero **Duration** value. Otherwise, **false**.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorType
member.summary: Specifies the repeat mode that a RepeatBehavior raw value represents.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorType.Count
member.summary: The RepeatBehavior represents a case where the timeline should repeat for a fixed number of complete runs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorType.Duration
member.summary: The RepeatBehavior represents a case where the timeline should repeat for a time duration, which might result in an animation terminating part way through.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorType.Forever
member.summary: The RepeatBehavior represents a case where the timeline should repeat indefinitely.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline
member.summary: Defines a duration and other behavior properties for a Windows Runtime animation. Timeline is the base class for Storyboard and all the Windows Runtime animation types, including those from the animation library and those used for custom animations in visual states or page-level XAML.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.#ctor
member.summary: Provides base class initialization behavior for Timeline -derived classes.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether dependent animations should be permitted to run, throughout the app.
member.returns: **true** if animations can run in the app for dependent animation cases. Otherwise, **false**. The default is **true**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.AutoReverse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the timeline plays in reverse after it completes a forward iteration.
member.returns: **true** if the timeline plays in reverse at the end of each iteration; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

member.summary: Identifies the AutoReverse Â dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the AutoReverse Â dependency property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which this Timeline should begin.
member.returns: The start time of the time line. The default value is zero.

member.summary: Identifies the BeginTime Â dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the BeginTime Â dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time for which this timeline plays, not counting repetitions.
member.returns: The timeline's simple duration: the amount of time this timeline takes to complete a single forward iteration. The default value is a Duration that evaluates as Automatic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.DurationProperty
member.summary: Identifies the Duration Â dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the Duration Â dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.FillBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how the animation behaves after it reaches the end of its active period.
member.returns: A value that specifies how the timeline behaves after it reaches the end of its active period but its parent is inside its active or fill period. The default value is **HoldEnd**.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.FillBehaviorProperty
member.summary: Identifies the FillBehavior Â dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the FillBehavior Â dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the repeating behavior of this timeline.
member.returns: An iteration **Count** that specifies the number of times the timeline should play, a **TimeSpan** value that specifies the total length of this timeline's active period, or the special value **Forever**, which specifies that the timeline should repeat indefinitely. The default value is a RepeatBehavior with a **Count** value of 1, which indicates that the timeline plays once.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehaviorProperty
member.summary: Identifies the RepeatBehavior Â dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the RepeatBehavior Â dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the rate, relative to its parent, at which time progresses for this Timeline.
member.returns: A finite value greater than 0 that specifies the rate at which time progresses for this timeline, relative to the speed of the timeline's parent. If this timeline is a root timeline, specifies the default timeline speed. The value is expressed as a factor where 1 represents normal speed, 2 is double speed, 0.5 is half speed, and so on. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatioProperty
member.summary: Identifies for the SpeedRatio Â dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the SpeedRatio Â dependency property.

member.summary: The page is never cached and a new instance of the page is created on each visit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationCacheMode.Enabled
member.summary: The page is cached, but the cached instance is discarded when the size of the cache for the frame is exceeded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationCacheMode.Required
member.summary: The page is cached and the cached instance is reused for every visit regardless of the cache size for the frame.

member.summary: Starts playing the loaded animated visual, or does nothing if no animated visual is loaded.
member.param: The point from which to start the animation, as a value from 0 to 1.
The point at which to finish the animation, as a value from 0 to 1.

The final size that the container computes for the child in layout.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.InvalidateArrange
member.summary: Invalidates the arrange state (layout) for all UIElement containers that reference this layout. After the invalidation, the UIElement will have its layout updated, which occurs asynchronously.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.InvalidateMeasure
member.summary: Invalidates the measurement state (layout) for all UIElement containers that reference this layout.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.Measure(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Suggests a DesiredSize for a container element. A container element that supports attached layouts should call this method from their own MeasureOverride implementations to form a recursive layout update. The attached layout is expected to call the Measure for each of the containerâs UIElement children.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

The available space that a container can allocate to a child object. A child object can request a larger space than what is available; the provided size might be accommodated if scrolling or other resize behavior is possible in that particular container.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects or based on other considerations such as a fixed container size.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.MeasureInvalidated
member.summary: Occurs when the measurement state (layout) has been invalidated.

member.summary: Removes any state the layout previously stored on the UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NavigationViewPaneDisplayMode
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how and where the NavigationView pane is shown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NavigationViewPaneDisplayMode.Auto
member.summary: The pane is shown on the left side of the control, and changes between minimal, compact, and full states depending on the width of the window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NavigationViewPaneDisplayMode.Left
member.summary: The pane is shown on the left side of the control in its fully open state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NavigationViewPaneDisplayMode.LeftCompact
member.summary: The pane is shown on the left side of the control. Only the pane icons are shown by default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NavigationViewPaneDisplayMode.LeftMinimal
member.summary: The pane is shown on the left side of the control. Only the pane menu button is shown by default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NavigationViewPaneDisplayMode.Top
member.summary: The pane is shown at the top of the control.

member.summary: Represents the base class for an object that sizes and arranges child elements for a host and and does not support virtualization.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout.ArrangeOverride(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, provides the behavior for the "Arrange" pass of layout. Classes can override this method to define their own "Arrange" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The final area within the container that this object should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size that is used after the element is arranged in layout.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout.InitializeForContextCore(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, initializes any per-container state the layout requires when it is attached to a UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout.MeasureOverride(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Measure" pass of the layout cycle. Classes can override this method to define their own "Measure" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects or based on other considerations such as a fixed container size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout.UninitializeForContextCore(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, removes any state the layout previously stored on the UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

Placement is relative to its target if Target is non-null or to the parent window of the teaching tip if Target is null.

member.summary: The preferred location of the teaching tip is along the bottom side of the xaml root when non-targeted and above the target element when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.LeftTop
member.summary: The preferred location of the teaching tip is the top left corner of the xaml root when non-targeted and left of the target element expanding upward when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.Right

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are aligned on the non-scrolling or non-virtualizing axis.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.Center
member.summary: Items are aligned in the center of the row or column, with extra space at the start and end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.End
member.summary: Items are aligned with the end of the row or column, with extra space at the start. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceAround
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly before and after each item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceBetween
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly between adjacent items. No space is added at the start or end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.Start
member.summary: Items are aligned with the start of the row or column, with extra space at the end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are sized to fill the available space.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.Fill
member.summary: The item is sized to fill the available space in the non-scrolling direction. Item size in the scrolling direction is not changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.None
member.summary: The item retains its natural size. Use of extra space is determined by the property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.Uniform
member.summary: The item is sized to both fill the available space in the non-scrolling direction and maintain its aspect ratio.

member.summary: Represents the base class for an object that sizes and arranges child elements for a host and supports virtualization.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayout.ArrangeOverride(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, provides the behavior for the "Arrange" pass of layout. Classes can override this method to define their own "Arrange" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The final area within the container that this object should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size that is used after the element is arranged in layout.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayout.InitializeForContextCore(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayoutContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, initializes any per-container state the layout requires when it is attached to a UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayout.MeasureOverride(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Measure" pass of the layout cycle. Classes can override this method to define their own "Measure" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects or based on other considerations such as a fixed container size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayout.OnItemsChangedCore(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.VirtualizingLayoutContext,System.Object,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Interop.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Notifies the layout when the data collection assigned to the container element (ItemsSource) has changed.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The data source.
Data about the collection change.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, removes any state the layout previously stored on the UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
